newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss hotel stays jump 7.7 pct yr/yr in May.
newsitem.headline: Swiss hotel stays jump 7.7 pct yr/yr in May.

text.p: Overnight stays in Swiss hotels jumped by 156,000 to 2.17 million in May, up 7.7 percent from the year-earlier month, the Federal Statistics Office said.
Good weather and the weaker Swiss franc played a major role in the increase, it said. But it noted May 1996 had been the poorest in 25 years.

In the five months of January to May, the number of overnight stays in Swiss hotels rose 2.2 percent to 12.21 million. The number of Swiss visitors rose 1.4 percent, while demand from abroad went up 2.8 percent.
